title: source packaging request - tar name, source directory and INSTALL
body:
by **schwehr**: 
While not required by any means, it would be really nice if go followed the more typical
source distribution convention. This would help speed go along towards more greater
adoption.  e.g.

- go-1.1.3.tar.{gz,bz2,xz} that unpacks as go-1.1.3
- go-1.1.3/INSTALL file rather than having to dig down into go/doc/install-source.html 
or at least just point from that top level INSTALL to the html file
